section.name: 10. Using Expressions

subsection.name: 10.5 In-Memory Evaluation
subsection.p: In additions to providing a database-independent WHERE clause for SQL queries, expressions support in-memory evaluation. An expressions can be evaluated with any type of objects that follow Java Beans method naming convention. Of course this includes DataObjects. The following API is used for expressions evaluation:

ul.li:
public boolean eval(Object object)
Returns true if an object matches expression criteria.

public java.util.List filterObjects(java.util.List objects)
Returns a list of objects from the original list that match expression criteria.
